title: SuDS
body:
$Sustainable Drainage Systems (SuDS)

On the 18th December 2014
body:summary: DCLG published a written statement to parliament explaining changes to the planning system in relation to major development: developments of 10 homes or more and 1
body:format: 000m<sup>2</sup> or more commercial development should ensure that sustainable drainage systems for the management of surface water run-off are put in place
body:language:
unless demonstrated to be inappropriate.

The National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) explains that sustainable development should not increase flood risk elsewhere and give priority to the use of sustainable drainage systems (paragraph 103). The National Planning Practice Guidance (NPPG) on Flood Risk and Coastal Changehas been updated (March 2015) to include information about involving the LLFA (chapter 16) and the importance of SuDS (chapter 21).

Policy 5.13 of the London Plan (2011
field_contact_button:
as consolidated 2015) requires SuDS in line with a drainage hierarchy.

Policy CE2(e) of the Core Strategy requires sustainable urban drainage (SuDS) to be incorporated within proposed developments wherever possible and states that the Council will:

"require sustainable urban drainage (SUDS)
field_contact_button:title: or other measures
field_contact_button:attributes: to reduce both the volume and the speed of water run-off to the drainage system ensuring that surface water run-off is managed as close to its source as possible in line with the hierarchy in the London Plan. In particular
field_contact_button:language:
major development must make a significant reduction in the current volume and speed of water run-off to the drainage system.”

To implement these policies
field_publish_date:
developers should ensure SuDS information is included in the planning applications.

Minor developments

For minor developments (up to a maximum of 10 dwellings or 1
field_publish_date:timezone:
000m² of non-residential property) the provision of SuDS could be achieved using our SuDS toof for small development. This tool calculates the increase of surface water run-off as a result of new impermeable surfaces associated with the development. It also gives different options of SuDS which can be implemented. The output of the tool is a pdf report showing the SuDS solutions chosen for that development. This report must be submitted along with the planning application. Please ensure that the plans and drawings submitted with the application show the location of the chosen SuDS otherwise the application will not be validated.

Please note

  • If the development will not lead to an increase in impermeable surfaces and surface water run-off
field_publish_date:rrule: then SuDS can not be calculated using this tool
field_publish_date:to:
but they are still required.
  • Basements: the SuDS Tool only applies to basement developments when: the basement extends beyond the above ground structure into the garden and there is less than 1m of permeable ground cover (soil) above the basement
field_expiry_date:
or when the ground above the basement is altered from permeable to impermeable. In this case please ensure you include an statement with your application explaining that the basement development does not need to provide extra SuDS.

The SuDS for small development webtool and the accompanying user guide can accessed below.

  • Small scale SuDS tool
field_expiry_date:rrule:
481|">User Guide [PDF] (file size 755Kb).

Please note that the guide was first produced for an access tool but to increase accessibility the format was changed to a web based tool.

Major development

For major developments
field_expiry_date:to:
SuDS should be considered from the outset at a very early stage of the process (masterplanning) to ensure they are fully integrated with the topography and conditions of the site. A SuDS strategy should be submitted including the following information:

  • Drainage layout: type of SuDS
field_site_section:

  • Landscape integration strategy

  • Details of surface water management during construction.

  • Run-off before and after construction

field_site_section:create_term:
aiming to achieve greenfield runoff

  • Foul drainage

  • Details on SuDS: type and discharge quantity

  • Adoption of SuDS (ownership)

field_service_hub:
